Sustainable construction methods include volumetric building, panelised systems and offsite manufacture (Modern Methods of Construction) which all have benefits in terms of limiting waste and increasing build quality and providing the opportunity for design for disassembly. Evidence of a commitment to low carbon and low emission energy sources for construction and related transport should also be demonstrated. Applicants should evidence how the development will meet the requirements set out in Part 5 of the policy in the design and access statement and/ or the sustainability statement, as part of the planning application. More detailed guidance can be found in the Sustainable Design and Construction Supplementary Planning Guidance (GLA 2014) and the Circular Economy Statement LPG (GLA 2022).
